result.execSummary:
The defendant John A. Eye was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. John A. Eye is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • John A. Eye was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John A. Eye

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
3:43 pm Defendant John A. Eye in court with attorney Breanna Magallones.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 17ct06, 17cm48, 17cf126, 16tr3359, 16ct199, 16cm536. Also calling 16cm59, 16tr63, 15tr3262,16tr62 and 15tr3263 - all fine reviews. 
Court will allow all cases in one payment plan - no need for review hearing if in payment plan and making monthly payments.  All cases scheduled for review hearing. 
Adj. 4:00 pm  Review hearing scheduled for December 4, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

2:06 p.m. Defendant John A. Eye in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns for Attorney Breanna Magallones.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 17cf126, 17cm48, 16cm536, 17ct06, 16ct199 and review hearings on 16cm59, 16tr62, 15tr3262, 15tr3263, 16tr3359 and 16tr63. Pfeifer statement that resolution was reached on cases until new charges were filed.  In 17cf126- In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 7, 2017 at 11:30 a.m. Pfeifer/Burns statement to bond. Defendant statement to bond/unpaid fines. Court statement to bond. Court sets bond. All matters to be scheduled for status conference on June 7, 2017 at 11:30 a.m. Adj. 2:16 p.m.

1:40 pm Defendant John A. Eye in court with attorney Breanna Magallones.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cm536, 16ct199, 17cm48, 17ct06, 16tr3359, 16tr63, 16cm59, 16tr62, 15tr3263, 15tr3262. Magallones believes that resolution is close - still waiting for discovery on one case from Attorney Penn - requests pre-trial conference in all matters. Bail continued. Review hearings continued until next pre-trial date. Adj. 1:44 pm  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 26, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant John A Eye in court with attorney Breanna Magallones.  Defendant John A Eye in custody.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the City of Rhinelander. Calling 15tr3263, 16tr62, 16tr63, 16cm59, 15tr3262. Magallones appears in 17ct06, 17cm48, 16cm536, 16ct199. In 17cm48 - Magallones - In receipt of complaint, waives further reading and enters not guilty plea. Court reinstates $2500 signature bond with same conditions and sets pre-trial conference for April 11, 2017 at 1:30 p.m. 
Cases for warrants for fail to pay - Defendant has 2 jobs available to him right now  - Culvers and Arbys - was supposed to start day before yesterday. Court quashes warrants and allows release. Review hearing scheduled for April 11, 2017 at 1:30 p.m. Court orders defendant to make payments between now and review hearing and attend review hearing with plan to pay off fines. Bail continued on other cases. Adj. 1:33 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for April 11, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

per Brandi @ ONSO - detainer - Marathon County
(WF added)
4:05 p.m. Defendant John A. Eye in court.  Defendant has set-up payment plan and is looking for employment. Adj. 4:08 pm

1:58 p.m. Defendant John A. Eye in court, via video, in custody.  Calling 16cm59, 16tr62, 15tr3263, 15tr3262, 16tr63. Court questions defendant as to non-payment/seeking employment. Defendant states he is in process of removing personal items from residence due to eviction. Has been informed of employment but has not filled out applications. Court quashes warrants and allows release. All matters set for June 20, 2016 at 3:00 p.m. , with 16cm59. Court informs defendant to obtain employment and make substantial payment. Defendant to appear on June 20, 2016 unless all matters are paid in full. If not employed by June 20, 2016, defendant to explain to Court in detail all attempts at seeking employment. Adj. 2:01 p.m.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
10:16 a.m. Defendant John A. Eye in court. Steven Mitchell Michlig, Asst. DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16CM59,16TR275,16TR274. Michlig statement to agreement/resolution. State moves to dismiss 16TR275, 16TR274, and Ct. 2 in 16CM59; granted by the Court. Court statement. Defendant still wishes to proceed without an attorney.  Defendant pleads guilty to Ct. 1 (OWI 2d). Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea; waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1. Court statement to sentencing.

Court sentence
$1,429 fine (inclusive of surcharges DNA/IID)
5 days jail w/Huber, commence on or before 4/15/16 at 4:00 p.m.
12 mo. d.l. revocation
AODA assessment & driver safety plan
12 mos. IID
DNA sample
Appeal Rights

The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).  Review hearing scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

3:10 p.m. Defendant John A. Eye in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cm59, 16tr274 and 16tr275. Defendant wishes to proceed on own - Waiver free and voluntary - Defendant wishes to enter guilty plea - Schiek states no lab results have been returned. .083 PBT. Bail continued. Adj. 3:16 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 10:15 am.

1:55 p.m. Defendant John A. Eye in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond. Adj. 1:58 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
